text: Mallorysville is an unincorporated community in Wilkes County, in the U.S. state of Georgia. ==History== Mallorysville was named after William Mallory, a county official. The Mallorysville post office closed in 1903. The Georgia General Assembly incorporated Mallorysville as a town in 1819. The town's municipal charter was repealed in 1995. ==References== Category:Former municipalities in Georgia (U.S. state) Category:Unincorporated communities in Wilkes County, Georgia Category:Populated places disestablished in 1995
title: Mallorysville, Georgia
